Class ZkSync

java.lang.Object
  ZkSync
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.zookeeper.Watcher
public class ZkSync
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.zookeeper.Watcher

Class that uses zookeeper's functionality to create higher level constructs like distributed locking. Multiple thread must not use one instanc of this class. Will cause trouble with internal state maintenance

Author:
Hasan Imam

getLock

public boolean getLock(java.lang.String lockDir,
                       java.lang.String lockPrefix)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
Gets a lock on an entity defined by lockPathPrefix. For example if you want a lock on the node: /Clients/Hasan, give a prefix like 'Hasan_lock-' and path should be '/Clients'. All entities that want to achive the lock must agree to provide the same prefix entry while calling this function. Function will block until this node gets the lock. It's very important to use this lock object in only one thread.

Parameters:
lockDir - The directory where the lock node will be created. Operation fails if given path is invalid, or this client does not have authority to create nodes in, or is Ephemeral (Ephemeral nodes cannot have child nodes)
lockPrefix - The same prefix needs to be provided by all entities that are trying to get the same lock. It's called prefix since it creates sequential nodes named path+prefix to implement the locking.
Returns:
True if the lock was successful
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException

unLock

public boolean unLock(java.lang.String lockDir,
                      java.lang.String lockPrefix)
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
Releases the lock that was acquired before. The arguments given should be the same as the ones given to get the lock while calling getLock(...) function

Parameters:
lockDir - The directory where the lock node was created.
lockPrefix - The same prefix used to get this lock
Returns:
True if the unlocking was successful. False if the lock doesnt exist or had other failures
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
